title: IOS app needs work
text: I love linkedin and have been using it for years but the app performance has proven to be pretty slow and often times buggy. It will often get stuck on certain sections and will be unresponsive for a few seconds until i close the app and start over.

title: Nice app but needs polishing.
text:
‚ÄúTop Applicant‚Äù and ‚ÄúMessage the job poster‚Äù icons in Jobs list are confusingly identical design and color and very obviously should not be and make it difficult to identify Top Applicant positions in a Jobs list.

Add filtering. Such as salary comparison and/or filtering mechanism +X% or -X% integrating the impact of state taxes on current location and pay, when provided.

title: I used to love LinkedIn
text:
I loved LinkedIn, it is actually the reason I have the job I do right now. I‚Äôve currently started looking for jobs in a career I‚Äôm going to school for but for some reason LinkedIn has started allowing businesses to Spam job listing and it‚Äôs irritating. No matter how many times I block the postings there‚Äôs more and more from the same two companies and they are for REVIEWS AND SURVEYS not even real jobs. 

Since this has started my app runs extremely slow as well, won‚Äôt even let me scroll have the time.

title: Job Search and Posting Improvements
text:
Ideas for job search-

Allow to search/filter for location within a company. Where ‚Äúremote‚Äù and ‚Äúhybrid‚Äù are options under location. Then, show all of the locations available in the filter and so you can pick multiple locations, including remote and hybrid. Or, make a completely separate filter for location that lists all locations of jobs posted in that company. 

For the job poster- 

make it a clear distinction for them to select when a position is ‚Äúremote anywhere‚Äù vs ‚Äúremote but you need to live within a certain city, state, country‚Äù. As a seeker, I can see ‚Äúremote‚Äù but I don‚Äôt know if there are still location restrictions on that. It might say New York, but I have to read the details to see the remote specifics. (If they‚Äôre there.)

title: Too many notifications/emails
text:
Had heard this was the way to look for jobs but so far I‚Äôm just getting a lot of messages and/or notifications that end up being nothing more than a waste of my time - will
more than likely being deleting it soon!

title: Too expensive
text: LinkedIn Premier for Career is $40 PER MONTH!!  A complete rip off!!  The extras are not worth $40 a month.

title: PLEASE fix the job search filters.
text: It‚Äôs so annoying to look at jobs for a particular company, only to have the company filter reset to ALL companies as soon as one starts to filter on geography.

title: Notifications Not Showing Up
text: Get the red balloon alert that I have a notification, but once I click on the bell, the page is blank.
